nanmad¶

isopy.nanmad(a, axis=<isopy.core.NotGivenType object>, scale='normal', level=1)¶

Compute the median absolute deviation along the specified axis, while ignoring NaNs.

Shortcut for scipy.stats.median_abs_deviation(a, axis, scale=scale, nan_policy='omit').

If level is less than 1 it assumes level represents a percentage point and recalculates level as scipy.stats.norm.ppf(0.5 + level/2).

Functions nanmad2 to nanmad5 are also avaliable where the last digits represents the level multiplication factor of the function. nanmad95 is also exists which represents a level value of 0.95.

Examples

>>> array = isopy.array(ru = [np.nan, 1.1, 2.2, 1.8],
                        pd = [3.1, 3.8, 2.9, 4.2],
                        cd = [6.1, 5.8, 4.7, 8.1])
>>> isopy.nanmad(array)
(row) , Ru      , Pd      , Cd
None  , 0.59304 , 0.66717 , 1.03782
>>> isopy.nanmad(array, axis=1)
array([2.22390333, 2.96520444, 1.03782155, 3.55824532])
>>> isopy.nanmad2(array) #same as nanmad(array, level=2)
(row) , Ru      , Pd      , Cd
None  , 1.18608 , 1.33434 , 2.07564
>>> isopy.nanmad95(array) #same as nanmad(array, level=0.95)
(row) , Ru      , Pd      , Cd
None  , 1.16234 , 1.30763 , 2.03409

See also

mad(), scipy.stats.median_abs_deviation
